since_last_update: Dominant driver has shifted from single-headline risk to a "macro-data gate" setup: U.S. futures are largely waiting on this week’s cluster (Retail Sales + ECI + NFP/UE), with positioning sensitive after a volatile prior week and a sharp Friday rebound (MarketWatch, Investopedia).

Equity tape remains internally split: industrial/old-economy leadership vs tech fragility, with Nasdaq still described as weaker despite the late-week rebound—keeping NQ more sensitive to rates and any renewed AI-capex/ROI narrative shocks (Investors.com).

Gold narrative is unstable/whippy recently: Reuters flagged a sharp precious-metals correction tied to profit-taking + USD/real-yield expectations and Fed leadership/policy uncertainty; this raises the probability of gold behaving pro-cyclical (down with risk) on hawkish data/rates impulses (Reuters via Investing.com).
today_focus: Today’s session is about pre-positioning (or staying light) into Tuesday’s high-impact U.S. data (Retail Sales/ECI) and Wednesday’s jobs print: the market is treating these as the next big policy-path inputs rather than reacting to incremental newsflow (MarketWatch, Investopedia).

Rates sensitivity remains the primary transmission mechanism for ES/NQ: any move in front-end expectations (hawkish growth/wages vs growth scare) is likely to dominate index-futures direction more than idiosyncratic single-stock stories (Investopedia, Investors.com).

Gold focus: watch whether bullion tracks safe-haven demand or gets re-anchored to real-yield and USD dynamics; recent episodes show both regimes are plausible, so correlation assumptions are higher risk than usual (Reuters via Investing.com).

Secondary: earnings/micro headlines exist (consumer staples/health/telecom names this week) but are likely to be tape-color unless they change the macro narrative (growth/inflation) or hit mega-cap duration sensitivity (MarketWatch, Investopedia).

dominant_driver.driver: Macro-data-driven rates repricing (growth vs wages/inflation) into a tight event cluster (Retail Sales + ECI + NFP/UE), with equity leadership divergence (Dow/old economy firmer vs Nasdaq more fragile).

what_seems_priced: Near-term direction is conditional on data: risk appetite is hesitant after a volatile week, implying markets are paying for optionality into macro prints rather than extending trend (MarketWatch, Investors.com).

Leadership divergence is being respected (Dow strength vs Nasdaq weakness), suggesting the market is implicitly pricing higher dispersion and higher factor risk (rates/duration) rather than a clean "risk-on" regime (Investors.com).
what_may_be_underpriced: Intraday sign-flip risk: the same data surprise can move ES/NQ and gold in the same direction if the rates impulse dominates (real yields up = equities down, gold down). Recent precious-metals volatility increases this tail (Reuters via Investing.com).
Gap/air-pocket risk around the data cluster given fragile tech tone and recent sharp rebounds (MarketWatch, Investors.com).

what_seems_priced: Policy-path sensitivity is high: markets are explicitly framing this week’s data as consequential for Fed expectations (Investopedia).
what_may_be_underpriced: Wage/ECI upside tail: a firm wage print could re-steepen front-end hawkish pricing quickly even if headline growth is merely steady, pressuring duration equities and potentially gold via real yields (inference; mechanism consistent with Reuters precious-metals framing).

what_seems_priced: Gold is trading with a 'regime uncertainty' premium: safe-haven bids can appear, but recent sharp corrections show positioning/profit-taking and USD/real-yield shocks can dominate (Reuters via Investing.com).
what_may_be_underpriced: Gold 'failed hedge' tail: if yields rise on hot wages/consumption, gold can sell off alongside equities, tightening conditions via cross-asset VAR/margin effects (inference; consistent with Reuters-described drivers of prior selloff).

risk_register.risk: Rates whipsaw around the Tue/Wed macro cluster (Retail Sales + ECI + NFP/UE): can flip ES/NQ and gold reactions intraday via real-yield impulse.
Nasdaq fragility / factor concentration: if the market re-focuses on AI-capex/ROI concerns, NQ downside can outpace ES even without broad risk-off.
Gold correlation regime risk: recent extreme precious-metals moves imply higher probability of disorderly positioning-driven selloffs on USD/real-yield spikes.
Headline/geopolitical tail (e.g., Iran-related risk) amplifies oil → inflation expectations channel, complicating the interpretation of 'growth vs inflation' data surprises.
Liquidity/positioning air-pocket after sharp rebound: early-session gaps and fast trend moves more likely around data releases.

event_warnings: Feb 9, 2026: Fed speakers (Waller, Bostic) — low scheduled impact but can matter if they lean into the upcoming data as policy-relevant (calendar input).
Feb 10, 2026 13:30 UTC: U.S. Retail Sales + Core Retail Sales — high impact; key for growth narrative and front-end rates (calendar input).
Feb 10, 2026 13:30 UTC: Employment Cost Index (ECI) — medium/high relevance because wages can dominate inflation persistence narratives (calendar input).
Feb 11, 2026 13:30 UTC: U.S. Nonfarm Payrolls + Unemployment Rate + AHE — high impact; likely the main weekly catalyst for ES/NQ and gold via rates (calendar input).
Feb 11, 2026 18:01 UTC: U.S. 10-year auction — usually low, but can matter if market is already rate-volatile post-data (calendar input).
Feb 12, 2026 13:30 UTC: Initial Jobless Claims — high impact in this context if it confirms/denies a jobs cooling narrative after NFP (calendar input).
